page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN DALRY(KIRK)
page.content: The main employers in the Glenkens area are farmers,the South of Scotland Electricity Board,the Forestry Commission and private forestry, and the District Council Roads Dept. There are few full time jobs for women but part time and seasonable work is available in the hotels and shops and as home help to the many elderly folk. Self employed tradesmen include a plumber,joiner,builder, house painter, slater and car mechanics.Some Dalry residents travel daily as far as Dumfries to their work, but others, including teachers nurses and oilrig workers, get home only periodically. Over the last ten years,despite the increasing lack of vacancies, there have never been more than 5 people under 18 unemployed. Over 18, numbers are slightly higher but all usually find employment eventually.
